item.title: Pokemon GO: December Spotlight Hour Schedule
item.description:
December is all around us, and it is the perfect time to play some Pokemon GO . The mobile game has hosted spotlight hours for a little over 4 years now, and it is still going strong as the end of another year comes closer. Every Tuesday, which is when the events take place, players will be able to get a large amount of whatever Pokemon is selected for that spotlight hour, which could lead to a Shiny or just a really powerful Pokemon with an excellent moveset.

During this event, players will also have the chance to gain some extra rewards to benefit from their in-game experience while catching Pokemon, such as getting different types of candy, XP, or Stardust, which are all important currencies in the game that help give players more of a boost. Candy and Stardust are used to level up and evolve their Pokemon or teach them new moves. Here are the Pokemon GO spotlight hours scheduled for December 2024.

Updated December 1, 2024, by Faith Lane: We've updated this Pokemon GO guide to reflect the upcoming Spotlight Hour events for December 2024. We'll be updating this guide every month as new hours are added to the PoGo schedule.

Pokemon GO Spotlight Hour Schedule for December 2024

Players will be getting a total of five spotlight hours this month, leading up to a pretty good lineup for Pokemon before the holidays and the end of the year. These spotlight hours take place between 6 PM and 7 PM every Tuesday , local time for the player. Pokemon GO is very accommodating in the sense of not having to follow any other time zone, but the one players are in. So, at 6 pm for the player's local time, it will also be that time in the game, unlike other games that go on their own day and night cycle.

During the spotlight hour timeframe, players won't have to put in any extra effort other than logging on and playing, as players will begin to see the map covered in the Pokemon selected for that Tuesday. From there, players can start catching the Pokemon and earning whatever rewards there are for that days event. Below is the spotlight schedule for December, along with the Pokemon and rewards that will be included during the hour long event:

  • December 3 - Sableye, double catch stardust
  • December 10 - Murkrow, double catch XP
  • December 17 - Slugma/Bergmite, double catch candy
  • December 24 - Delibird, double transfer candy
  • December 31 - Togetic, double evolution XP

The Pokemon that have been selected for this month's spotlight hours are good choices, considering many of them are Pokemon that we mainly see spawning in the winter - with Togetic being a Pokemon that is often item featured in holiday events.

All the Pokemon listed above are also available in a Shiny variant. This means that while the Spotlight Hours are happening, players will have an increased chance of catching one since the spawn rates have already increased. This is another big upside to playing in the spotlight hours outside of the standard rewards.

The Spotlight Hours change every month with different Pokemon, so be sure to check back next month for our January 2025 Spotlight Hour schedule, which will cover what to expect in terms of the Pokemon and rewards each Tuesday. That is everything we know about the spotlight schedule for December so far.

item.title: Shadow Fight 3 Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
The Shadow Fight games are certainly some of the best representatives of the Fighting genre on mobile devices, as the third part combines all the best features from previous games. As a result, players have access to extensive customization of weapons and equipment, which significantly affects the gameplay. To get more equipment fast, you can use Shadow Fight 3 Codes.

These Codes will reward you with various items and resources that will help you progress faster. However, they are active for a fairly short time, so you should redeem them as quickly as possible.

Updated December 2, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: Currently, no codes are active. Keep this page handy, as it will be updated when fresh codes are released for you.

All Shadow Fight 3 Codes

As befits the genre, in Shadow Fight 3, your victory mainly depends on your skills and knowledge of combos. But often, you will encounter enemies who can reduce your health bar in two hits. In this case, you need to upgrade your equipment or find a new one. This requires various resources and currencies, which, fortunately, can be obtained using Shadow Fight 3 Codes.

Nekki developers release Codes quite rarely. However, even one Code can contain quite a few rewards, including Keys, Gems, and more. Below, you will find a list of all active Codes for Shadow Fight 3 .

Active Codes

  • No active codes.

Expired Codes

  • SURVEY24 - Mnemonium, Legendary Keys, Gems, Epic Keys, and Shadow Energy.

How to Redeem Shadow Fight 3 Codes

As mentioned earlier, each code expires after a certain time. Therefore, you should know how to use them. Fortunately, this is quite easy to do. So, follow these steps to redeem Shadow Fight 3 Codes:

  1. Launch Shadow Fight 3 .
  2. Complete the tutorial. It will take no more than 10 minutes and a couple of fights.
  3. Go to the Store menu by clicking on the button with the bag and cards.
  4. Then go to the Free tab and click on Input Promocode.
  5. After this, you will only have to enter one of the codes described above.
  6. Finally, click OK to receive your free goodies.
  7. If you are late and the code has already expired, you will see a corresponding message.

How to Get More Shadow Fight 3 Codes

The easiest way not to miss the new Shadow Fight 3 Codes is to follow this guide. We will update it as soon as the developers release new free rewards. Also, players can join the official Discord server of the game. There, the developers report new updates, including codes.

Shadow Fight 3 is available on mobile devices.

item.title: Fortnite: All Chapter 6 Season 1 Accolades
item.description:
Accolades have been in Fortnite for a few years now, but a few seasons ago, Epic Games decided that it wanted fans to take them more seriously than ever. Before, gamers would be rewarded XP for completing certain Accolades, but unless they memorized them after getting them for the first time, there was no way of knowing what they had to do to unlock them.

This is why an Accolades collection was added to Fortnite , allowing players to check them at any time they'd like. This feature incentivizes fans to try to complete all Accolades available and acquire them as many times as possible so they can compare their stats with their friends near the end of the season.

How to Get Accolades in Fortnite

There are 171 Accolades to unlock in Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 1 . Accolades work like in-game achievements, and players will naturally unlock most of them simply by playing Fortnite Battle Royale. However, some of them require gamers to do specific tasks in-game, and they won't be able to get them unless they check out the Accolades list in the Collection tab. The Collection tab can be found in the Quests menu, which can be accessed while in the lobby .

Players should make a note of the Accolades they'd like to unlock and then play a match following its exact requirements . For example, the "Knife to a Gun Fight" Accolade can only be obtained if the player wins a match only dealing damage with melee weapons - doing this by chance is nearly impossible.

Complete Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 1Accolades List

Here are the various Accolade categories in Fortnite :

First in Match

# Accolade Description
1 Early Bird First player to pick up a legendary or better item
2 Finders Keepers First player to collect a weapon from an eliminated player
3 First Strike First player to get an elimination
4 Quick Exit First player to be eliminated
5 Battle Ready First player to reach maximum shields
6 First Landing First player to touch the ground
7 Smash and Grab First player to search a chest
8 Ammo Ace First player to search an ammo box
9 First Supply Drop First player to search a supply drop
10 First Catch First player to catch a fish
11 Swift Scavenge First player to forage
12 Adventure Buddies First player to hire a character
13 Fast Talker First player to talk with a character
14 The Gift of Life First player to reboot a player
15 Patch Up, Pronto! First player to revive a player
16 Shopping Spree First player to purchase an item
17 First Modification First player to modify a weapon
18 Shady Help Wanted First player to complete a SHADOW Briefing

Weapons

# Accolade Description
1 Assault Specialist 500 Assault Rifle damage in a match
2 Assault Expert 1,000 Assault Rifle damage in a match
3 Assault Master 2,000 Assault Rifle damage in a match
4 Shotgun Specialist 500 Shotgun damage in a match
5 Shotgun Expert 1,000 Shotgun damage in a match
6 Shotgun Master 2,000 Shotgun damage in a match
7 SMG Specialist 500 SMG damage in a match
8 SMG Expert 1,000 SMG damage in a match
9 SMG Master 2,000 SMG damage in a match
10 Pistol Specialist 500 Pistol damage in a match
11 Pistol Expert 1,000 Pistol damage in a match
12 Pistol Master 2,000 Pistol damage in a match
13 Explosives Specialist 500 Explosive damage in a match
14 Explosives Expert 1,000 Explosive damage in a match
15 Explosives Master 2,000 Explosive damage in a match
16 Melee Specialist 500 Melee damage in a match
17 Melee Expert 1,000 Melee damage in a match
18 Melee Master 2,000 Melee damage in a match
19 Mist of Metal 250 Shots fired in a match
20 Raining Lead 500 Shots fired in a match
21 High Caliber Hail 1,000 Shots fired in a match
22 Jack of All Trades Deal damage with 5 different weapon types in a match

Combat

# Accolade Description
1 Single Digit 5 Eliminations in a match
2 Double Digits 10 Eliminations in a match
3 Elimination Collector 15 Eliminations in a match
4 Elimination Hoarder 20 Eliminations in a match
5 Elimination Escapade 25 Eliminations in a match
6 Speed Bump Hit a player with a vehicle
7 Double Elimination 2 Eliminations within a short duration
8 Multi Elimination 3 Eliminations within a short duration
9 Mega Elimination 4 Eliminations within a short duration
10 Ultra Elimination 5 Eliminations within a short duration
11 Epic Elimination 6 Eliminations within a short duration
12 Anti-Air Personnel Hit an airborne player
13 Headshot Player downed with a headshot
14 Head Hunter 10 Headshots hit in a match
15 Get Ahead 25 Headshots hit in a match
16 Off the Dome 50 Headshots hit in a match
17 First to the Feast Eliminate a player within 10 seconds of landing
18 Distance Shot Player downed over 100 meters away
19 Long Shot Player downed over 150 meters away
20 Ludicrous Shot Player downed over 200 meters away
21 Impossible Shot Player downed over 250 meters away
22 Unfollowed Eliminated a follower
23 Right Back at You 1,000 Damage to players that have damaged you in a match
24 Vengeful Revenge Eliminate a player that eliminated you in a match

Victory Royale

# Accolade Description
1 Against the World Win a Squads match as a Solo
2 Three to One Odds Win a Trios match as a Solo
3 Two to One Odds Win a Duos match as a Solo
4 Pacifist Win a match without eliminating an opponent
5 True Pacifist Win a match without damaging an opponent
6 This One's For You Win a match after thanking the Bus Driver
7 I'm Fine, Really Win a match without restoring health
8 Who Needs 'Em Win a match without gaining shields
9 There's No Time Win a match without reloading
10 This Isn't Zero Build? Win a match in Build Mode without building
11 One Man's Trash Only deal damage with Common Weapons and win
12 One Man's Treasure Only deal damage with Legendary Weapons or better and win
13 Maximum Overshields Win a match without losing health
14 Knife to a Gun Fight Win a match only dealing damage with melee weapons
15 One and Done Win a match only collecting a single weapon
16 Cannot be Contained Win a match without searching containers
17 Storm Runner Win a match without taking storm damage
18 Over Throne Win a match after capturing a player's crown
19 Royal Preservation Win a match with a Victory Crown
20 Succession Captured a Victory Crown
21 One Shall Rule Eliminated a crown wearer while wearing a crown
22 Crown Spree 3 Eliminations while wearing a crown
23 Royale Vengeance 5 Eliminations while wearing a crown
24 All Hail the Crown 10 Eliminations while wearing a crown

Survival

# Accolade Description
1 Survivor I 50 Players remaining
2 Survivor II 25 Players remaining
3 Survivor III 10 Players remaining
4 Medical Specialist 250 Health restored in a match
5 Medical Expert 500 Health restored in a match
6 Medical Master 1.000 Health restored in a match
7 Shield Specialist 250 Shields gained in a match
8 Shield Expert 500 Shields gained in a match
9 Shield Master 1.000 Shields gained in a match
10 Can of Worms 5 Fish caught in a match
11 Fishmonger 10 Fish caught in a match
12 Pescetarian 15 Fish caught in a match
13 Light Breeze 100 Storm damage survived in a match
14 Barely Raining 250 Storm damage survived in a match
15 Batten the Hatches 500 Storm damage survived in a match
16 Actually Use Bandages Bandages used during a match
17 Warm Respite Health restored using a campfire

Resources

# Accolade Description
1 Loot Collector 5 Chests searched in a match
2 Loot Stockpiler 10 Chests searched in a match
3 Loot Hoarder 20 Chests searched in a match
4 Ammo Scrounger 5 Ammo boxes searched in a match
5 Ammo Scavenger 10 Ammo boxes searched in a match
6 Ammo Accumulator 20 Ammo boxes searched in a match
7 Big Spender 500 Bars spent in a match
8 High Roller 1,000 Bars spent in a match
9 Compulsive Shopper 2,000 Bars spent in a match
10 Gold Rush 250 Bars collected in a match
11 Gilded Glory 500 Bars collected in a match
12 Treasure Trove 1,000 Bars collected in a match
13 Demolition Specialist 50 Structures destroyed in a match
14 Demolition Expert 250 Structures destroyed in a match
15 Demolition Master 500 Structures destroyed in a match
16 Village Builder 50 Structures built in a match
17 Town Builder 100 Structures built in a match
18 City Builder 200 Structures built in a match
19 Bottomless Clip 1.000 Ammo collected in a match
20 Resourcefulness 1.000 Resources collected in a match

Social

# Accolade Description
1 Reboot Revenge Win a match after being rebooted
2 The Royal Party Each squad member is holding a Victory Crown in a match
3 Show Time 500 Damage to players as the last player standing in your squad
4 No One Left Behind Collected a Reboot Card in the storm in a match
5 Stay Down Eliminated a player that was rebooted in a match
6 Eye in the Sky 5 Map Markers placed while in a squad
7 Mending Machine 250 Health restored to squadmates in a match
8 Shield Supervisor 250 Shields restored to squadmates in a match
9 Reboot Van Rebooting... 3 Reboots in a match
10 Support Class 3 Assists in a match
11 Helping Hand Follower revived player or squad member
12 Hype Squad 60 Seconds jamming with players in a match
13 Celebrated Crawler 50 Meters traveled while DBNO
14 Relentless Revived 3 times in a match
15 Friends til the End 100 Meters traveled carrying a DBNO opponent
16 Carrying 3 Revives in a match
17 Hand Me Downs 3 Weapons collected dropped by players in a match
18 Spare Change 100 Ammo collected dropped by players in a match
19 Head on a Swivel 10 Opponents marked by Scout Specialists in a match
20 Collateral Damage 250 Damage dealt by Heavy Specialists in a match
21 Supplies Inbound 100 Ammo supplied by Supply Specialists in a match
22 Doctor's Orders 100 Health restored by Medic Specialists in a match
23 You Shouldn't Have 3 Gifts collected from NPCs in a match

Special

# Accolade Description
1 Still Got 'Em Elimination after being knocked or eliminated
2 Graffiti Artist 10 Sprays in a match
3 Emotional Intelligence 10 Emotes in a match
4 Better Late Than Never Land after the first storm forms
5 SHADOW Organization 2 SHADOW Briefings completed in a match
6 Flying Fortune 3 Supply Drones destroyed in a match
7 Rift-Tastic 3 Rifts used in a match
8 Only the Best Have an inventory full of Legendary items or better
9 Fruits and Veggies 5 Different Fruits or Vegetables consumed in a match
10 Thank You Kindly Thanked the Bus Driver in a match
11 Thank the Conductor 2,500 Meters traveled on the train in a match
11 Road Rage 1,000 Damage while in a vehicle in a match
12 Road Trip 2,500 Damage traveled in a vehicle

Seasonal

# Accolade Description
1 Cyclone Slashing 1,000 Typhoon Blade damage in a match
2 Demonic Rage 1,000 Fire Oni Mask damage in a match
3 Demonic Laughter Void Oni Mask teleportation in a match
4 Fiend Slayer 2 Demon Warriors eliminated in a match
5 Demon Hunter 10 Demon Grunts eliminated in a match
6 Waterbound Restoration 100 Health restored by Water Sprites
7 Windbound Teleportation Launched from a Wind Sprite in a match
8 Earthbound Belch Weapon consumed by an Earth Sprite in a match
9 Boonderful Bounty 4 Boons collected in a match
10 Powerful Parkour 20 Wall Kicks, Wall Scrambles, Ledge Jumps, or Roll Landing in a match

item.title: Super Mario RPG: How To Use The Mystery Egg (Unlock Lamb's Lure)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get The Mystery Egg In Super Mario RPG
  • How To Use The Mystery Egg In Super Mario RPG
  • How To Use Lamb's Lure In Super Mario RPG

In Super Mario RPG , there are plenty of items that you can pick up for your party to enhance them or give them a boost to their stats. However, when you go shopping in the game, you might occasionally stumble on items that don't have a particular stated use, meaning what they do for you is a mystery.

One of these items is the Mystery Egg, an item that can be purchased and eventually used by your team. However, many players have remained stumped after purchasing the item, unsure how to activate or use it. If you are stuck and want to know how to use the Mystery Egg in Super Mario RPG , this guide explains what you need to do.

Where To Get The Mystery Egg In Super Mario RPG

Before you attempt to use the Mystery Egg in Super Mario RPG , you will first need to make sure you have the item in your inventory. If you don't have one, the only place where the item can be purchased is from the treasure-hunting Toad in Moleville . Specifically, you'll want to visit the Item Shop in the town, which can be found on the western side, just below the Fireworks Shop.

Mystery Egg Information

Item

Type

Buy Price

Description

Mystery Egg

Attack

200 Coins

A product of pure love...

How To Use The Mystery Egg In Super Mario RPG

After you've obtained the Mystery Egg, the only way you can utilize it is by equipping Peach with the Nurture Ring . To get the item, all you will need to do is visit Marrymore Hotel Shop and purchase it for 145 Coins.

The shop can be found in the building on the left in Marrymore, on the first floor.

You'll need to give the Nurture Ring to Peach and have her equip it. While in battle, you'll want to have Peach use the Mystery Egg 10 times . When it is her turn in battle, just choose Item, and then click the Mystery Egg. Eventually, you'll receive the Lamb's Lure as a reward, and a message will pop up on the screen:

You're a great shepherd!

How To Use Lamb's Lure In Super Mario RPG

With the Lamb's Lure now in your inventory, you might be wondering what exactly it can be used for. It's a pretty simple item that can easily get you out of battles against low-level enemies (and occasionally more powerful enemies in later regions). When in battle, go to your Items, and choose the Lamb's Lure and use it against an enemy. There's a high chance they will instantly turn into a lamb and get taken away.

However, keep in mind that when you use this item, you will not get any coins or experience afterward. So, this item is mostly to be used to avoid unexpected battles with weaker enemies that won't yield much of a reward anyway.

item.title: LEGO's Leaked James Bond Game Explained
item.description:
The Traveler's Tales era of LEGO videogames had a stranglehold over thousands of childhoods, with dozens of IPs being rendered in its classic formula. Recently, a new discovery has been made about one of TT's scrapped LEGO titles, one that's been known in fan circles for some time.

With games like LEGO Horizon Adventures not quite meeting expectations, the longing for more classic-era LEGO games is more than apparent. Given that TT's loss of exclusivity over LEGO games coincided with allegations of crunch conditions at the studio, it's likely for the best that LEGO moved on from it—but the company's games still have draws worth keeping. A winning collectathon formula, decent narratives, memorable gags, and a style of animation and humor distinct from the LEGO Movie style pursued by something like Horizon Adventures .

New Information About The LEGO James Bond Game Has Leaked

Interestingly, there are a number of TT LEGO projects that never made the light of day. After the success of 2005's LEGO Star Wars , which immediately cemented the LEGO game formula, the company made a few test animations to pitch some more LEGO game ideas. These pitch videos were released by Jon Burton, former director of TT games, on the YouTube channel GameHut. Included were never-before-seen test clips for a James Bond game and a Tomb Raider game, neither of which saw the light of day beyond this test; not only did LEGO find these IPs too dark, but they both lacked a toyline backing.

However, a new discovery has been made about the former pitch, which is a leaked LEGO James Bond trailer. The footage was reportedly found within a build of LEGO Dimensions , a toys-to-life LEGO game that saw a number of IPs crossing over via the multiverse. The game includes a number of IPs that are yet to receive standalone LEGO sets (such as Gremlins and Goonies ), so James Bond would've fit right in (even though there are now some LEGO sets based on his Aston Martin car). The question of this trailer's legitimacy, as well as whether it plays into the original 2005 pitch, is hotly debated.

The Leaked LEGO James Bond Trailer Looks Real, But Not Like The 2005 Pitch

The leaked trailer is a dead ringer for a LEGO Traveler's Tales game. While there's nothing to confirm its legitimacy, though the copyright takedowns of the leak do suggest that somewhat, the humor and animation are spot on. Gags such as insertions of a LEGO pig, skeleton minifigures shown during electrocution, comical takes on famous scenes, and kid-friendly interpretations of violent moments are all TT hallmarks.

However, it's unlikely that this lines up with the original LEGO James Bond pitch from 2005. The animation style, the look of the minifigures, and the overall fidelity (as well as the fact that characters can speak) are more indicative of the TT style that came about post-2012, following on from games like LEGO Batman 2 and LEGO Lord of the Rings . The question is then whether the footage is from scrapped LEGO Dimensions content or a scrapped standalone game. Both are possible, but there's some credence to it being a LEGO Dimensions expansion. Not only did LEGO Dimensions bring in more mature IP, but its inclusion of Doctor Who allowed the player to switch between versions of the Doctor, a system that would map very well onto James Bond.

Given the conception of a game like LEGO Horizon Adventures , a James Bond LEGO game today isn't impossible. In fact, the circumstances for making the latter would be very similar to LEGO's most recent video game effort. However, there's little to no chance that a full version of what was teased in these leaks (or in the 2005 pitch) will ever come to fruition, especially now TT has seemingly moved on from LEGO.
